thread.title: Lutheran East shuts out Delphos St. John's in third quarter of Falcons' 50-25 Division IV state semifinal win
thread.title_full: Lutheran East shuts out Delphos St. John's in third quarter of Falcons' 50-25 Division IV state semifinal win

author: Tim Bielik, cleveland.com
title: Lutheran East shuts out Delphos St. John's in third quarter of Falcons' 50-25 Division IV state semifinal win
text:
More News | More Photos | More Videos 
COLUMBUS, Ohio — Lutheran East’s high-pressure defense pitched a third-quarter shutout of Delphos St. John’s on its way to a 50-25 Division IV state semifinal win on Thursday at the Schottenstein Center. 
The Falcons (19-9) scored 21 points in the third quarter after being held to 16 in the first half. They had a 16-13 halftime lead on Delphos St. John’s (21-5) after both teams struggled to score. 
Jordan Burge led Lutheran East with 16 points, and Maurico Tate added 10. 
Lutheran East relied on its full-court pressure and turned the Blue Jays over 18 times. It also held Delphos St. John's to 28 percent shooting and nine made field goals. 
The Falcons will play either Columbus Wellington or Lima Perry on Saturday in the Division IV championship game at 2 p.m.
